column4: How do I change the "message of the day" that appears when you login to a user on the command line? I edited /etc/motd but this doesn't appear to be persistent after a reboot.
i think /etc/motd is autogenerated by the /etc/init.d/bootmisc.sh init script
ok, thanks - I;ll look into changing that then :-)
that would indicate that I should edit /etc/motd.tail with my new message?
yes - edgy server edition (the box in question)
then in edgy they changed the location of the motd file. i think is used to be /etc/motd, now it seems its /var/run/motd
oh, I thought /var/run was a weird dir that was auto-generated. I'm not that expert in booting stuff :-) Thanks for the pointer!
so how can I edit /var/run then? It won't be persistent after a reboot!
no, you edit /etc/motd.tail, it gets appended to the generated file in /var/run at each boot
Oh, so I can't remove the default stuff about ubuntu then?
of course you could modify the bootmisc.sh script, but that wouldnt be "clean"
yeah, I know what you mean, it doesn't feel right to do it that way :-)
